name: Chicken Bhuna
ingredients: 4 chicken breasts, cut into small pieces
method:
1. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat. 2. Add the onions, garlic, and green chilies and fry for 5-7 minutes until the onions are golden brown. 3. Add the chicken pieces and fry for 5-7 minutes until the chicken is sealed and lightly browned. 4. Add the turmeric, cumin, coriander, and paprika and stir well. 5. Add salt to taste and cook for a further 10-15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
6. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

name: Prawn Curry
method: 1. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat. 2. Add the onions, garlic, and green chilies and fry for 5-7 minutes until the onions are golden brown. 3. Add the prawns and fry for 5-7 minutes until they are pink and lightly cooked. 4. Add the turmeric, cumin, coriander, and paprika and stir well. 5. Add salt to taste and cook for a further 5 minutes or until the prawns are fully cooked. 6. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

name: Lamb Bhuna
method: 1. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat. 2. Add the onions, garlic, and green chilies and fry for 5-7 minutes until the onions are golden brown. 3. Add the lamb pieces and fry for 5-7 minutes until the lamb is sealed and lightly browned. 4. Add the turmeric, cumin, coriander, and paprika and stir well. 5. Add salt to taste and cook for a further 10-15 minutes or until the lamb is cooked through. 6. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

name: Chingri Bhapa
method:
1. Clean and devein the prawns. Set aside.
2. Mix grated coconut, mustard paste, turmeric powder, and salt together in a bowl.
3. Add the prawns to the mixture and mix well.
4. Cut banana leaves into square pieces and put a spoonful of the prawn mixture on each leaf piece.
5. Wrap the banana leaf into a small parcel and tie with kitchen twine.
6. Place the parcels in a steamer and steam for 15-20 minutes.
7. Serve hot with rice.

name: Beef Bhuna
method:
1. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
2. Add the onions, garlic, and green chilies and fry for 5-7 minutes until the onions are golden brown.
3. Add the beef pieces and fry for 5-7 minutes until the beef is sealed and lightly browned.
4. Add the ginger paste, turmeric, cumin, coriander, and paprika and stir well.
5. Add salt to taste and cook for a further 10-15 minutes or until the beef is cooked through.
6. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

name: Spicy Fish Curry
method:
1. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
2. Add the onions, garlic, and green chilies and fry for 5-7 minutes until the onions are golden brown.
3. Add the fish pieces and fry for 5-7 minutes until the fish is sealed and lightly browned.
4. Add the ginger paste, turmeric, cumin, coriander, and paprika and stir well.
5. Add salt to taste and cook for a further 5 minutes.
6. Add water and bring to a boil.
7. Cover and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until the fish is fully cooked.
8. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

name: Roshmalai
ingredients: Slivered almonds and pistachios for garnishing
method:
1. In a large pot, bring the milk to a boil. Add the vinegar and water mixture to the milk, stirring constantly. The milk will curdle and the whey will separate from the curd. 
2. Strain the curdled milk through a cheesecloth or muslin cloth. Rinse the curdled milk under running water to remove the vinegar taste. 
3. Tie the cloth with the curdled milk into a tight knot and hang it for 1 hour to remove excess water. 
4. In a large pot, boil the water, sugar, cardamoms, and saffron until the sugar has dissolved. 
5. Add the cheese balls to the sugar syrup and simmer on medium heat for 20 minutes, or until the cheese balls have doubled in size. 
6. Remove from heat and let it cool. Add rose water to the syrup. Garnish with slivered almonds and pistachios before serving.

name: Chom Chom
ingredients: Slivered almonds and pistachios for garnishing
method:
1. In a large pot, bring the milk to a boil. Add lemon juice to the milk, stirring constantly. The milk will curdle and the whey will separate from the curd. 
2. Strain the curdled milk through a cheesecloth or muslin cloth. Rinse the curdled milk under running water to remove the lemon taste. 
3. Tie the cloth with the curdled milk into a tight knot and hang it for 1 hour to remove excess water. 
4. In a large pot, boil the water, sugar, cardamoms, and saffron until the sugar has dissolved. 
5. Add the cheese balls to the sugar syrup and simmer on medium heat for 20 minutes, or until the cheese balls have doubled in size. 
6. Remove from heat and let it cool. Add rose water to the syrup. Garnish with slivered almonds and pistachios before serving.

name: Puli Pitha
method:
1. In a bowl, mix the rice flour, salt, and water to make a dough.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the grated coconut and jaggery to make a filling.
3. Take a small amount of dough and flatten it with your palm. Place a spoonful of the filling in the center and fold the dough over it, sealing the edges.
4. Place the pithas in a steamer and steam for 10-15 minutes.
5. Serve hot.

name: Alu posto
method:
1. Soak poppy seeds in water for 1 hour.
2. Drain the water and grind the poppy seeds to a fine paste.
3. Heat oil in a pan. Add the cubed potatoes, turmeric powder and salt. Fry until the potatoes turn golden brown.
4. Add the poppy seed paste and green chillies. Mix well.
5. Add 1/2 cup of water and cook for 10-12 minutes until the potatoes are cooked and the gravy thickens.
6. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Palong shak Vaja
method:
1. Clean and wash the spinach. Chop the leaves and tender stems.
2. Heat mustard oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds and green chillies.
3. Add the chopped spinach, salt and mix well.
4. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes until the spinach wilts and the water evaporates.
5. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Roshogolla
ingredients: A few drops of rose water
method:
1. Boil milk in a pan. Once it comes to a boil, add lemon juice and stir until the milk curdles.
2. Pour the curdled milk into a muslin cloth and rinse under cold running water. Squeeze the excess water.
3. In a separate pan, add water and sugar. Bring to a boil.
4. Add the squeezed chenna balls into the boiling sugar syrup.
5. Cover the pan and cook for 10-12 minutes until the chenna balls double in size.
6. Add a few drops of rose water and switch off the flame.
7. Let the rasgullas cool down to room temperature and then refrigerate for 1-2 hours before serving.

name: Shorshe Ilish
method:
1. Marinate the Hilsa pieces with turmeric and salt for 15 minutes.
2. Heat mustard oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry the Hilsa pieces until golden brown. Keep them aside.
3. In the same oil, add the onion and green chilies and fry until the onion turns golden brown.
4. Add the mustard paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Fry for 2-3 minutes.
5. Add 1 cup of water and bring it to a boil.
6. Add the fried Hilsa pieces and let it simmer for 5-7 minutes or until the gravy thickens.
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Fish Kalia
method:
1. Marinate the fish with salt and turmeric powder and fry them until lightly browned.
2. In another pan, heat the oil and add the onions. Fry until the onions become translucent.
3. Add ginger paste and garlic paste and fry for a minute.
4. Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and turmeric powder. Fry for a minute.
5. Add the tomato puree and fry until the oil separates from the masala.
6. Add the fried fish, green chilies, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
7. Add the yogurt and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
8. Remove from heat and serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Misti doi
method:
1. Heat the milk in a heavy-bottomed pan on low flame until it comes to a boil.
2. Add sugar and cardamom powder, and stir well until the sugar dissolves.
3. Remove the pan from heat and let it cool down.
4. Once the milk has cooled down to lukewarm, add yogurt and mix well.
5. Pour the mixture into clay pots or ramekins.
6. Add a few saffron strands on top of each pot or ramekin.
7. Cover the pots or ramekins with a lid or plastic wrap and keep them in a warm place for 5-6 hours or until set.
8. Once the Mishti Doi is set, refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

name: Dim bhuna masala
ingredients: Chopped fresh coriander leaves for garnish
method:
1. Hard boil the eggs, peel and cut each egg into 4 pieces.
2. Heat oil in a frying pan and fry the sliced onions until golden brown.
3. Add ginger and garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Fry for 2 minutes.
4. Add the chopped tomatoes and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and the oil separates from the masala.
5. Add the boiled eggs and fry for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
7. Serve hot with rice or chapati.

name: Payesh
method:
1. Rinse the rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
2. In a large pot, bring the milk to a boil. Reduce the heat and add the soaked rice. Simmer on low heat for 30-40 minutes, stirring frequently, until the rice is cooked and the milk has thickened.
3. Add sugar, raisins, almonds, pistachios, cashews, cardamom pods, and cinnamon stick. Cook for another 10-15 minutes, stirring frequently.
4. Add the rose water, vanilla extract, and salt. Stir well and remove from heat.
5. Allow the payesh to cool and then refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

name: Chicken Korma
ingredients: 2 lbs boneless chicken, cut into cubes
method:
1. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute.
2. Add chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
3. Add cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper and stir to combine. Cook for 1 minute.
4. Add diced tomatoes and chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook for 20 minutes.
5. Stir in heavy cream and season with salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 5 minutes.
6. Serve with rice or naan.
